article.headline: West Virginia 82, New Hampshire 48
article.story: MORGANTOWN, W.Va. (AP) -- Mike Gansey scored 16 points and West Virginia tied a school single-game record with 14 3-pointers in beating New Hampshire 82-48 Tuesday night. The Mountaineers, 8-0 for the first time in 22 years, held an opponent under 55 points for the fifth straight game. Now it gets more difficult. The Mountaineers host No. 20 George Washington on Dec. 29, then head to No. 16 N.C. State four days later. West Virginia has yet to play a ranked foe this season and has beaten opponents by an average of 27 points. The Mountaineers hit 14 3-pointers against New Hampshire, tying a school record set last year against St. John's and equaled earlier this season against Duquesne. West Virginia led 41-15 at halftime. New Hampshire (4-5) had just four first-half field goals, marking the fourth straight game WVU has held a foe to less than 22 points at the break. West Virginia's student section clapped sarcastically when New Hampshire got its first points 6:29 into the game. WVU had led 14-0 after making four straight 3-pointers. The Mountaineers led by as much as 82-38. New Hampshire scored the last 10 points of the game. Darris Nichols and Kevin Pittsnogle came off the West Virginia bench to score 10 points each. Blagoj Janev led New Hampshire with 12 points.
